0ef5b9bd-8050-4779-afe0-15fd2c878beb.description: Earners of Suffolk University's EDGE Python Workshop Badge will gain knowledge in one of the most popular and in-demand programming languages in the world, Python. Attendees of the workshop will learn Python syntax, the development environment, and Python basics. Additionally, learners will explore data with the Pandas library, build an engaging data analytics dashboard in the form of a web application, and finally, create, upload, and share a repository in the GitHub.
0ef5b9bd-8050-4779-afe0-15fd2c878beb.name: Suffolk University's EDGE Python Workshop Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge must attend a 1.5-hour intensive workshop.

39a438ae-d176-4129-879e-e1457331c44b.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Process Improvement and Legal Project Management badge will be able to deliver legal services with greater efficiency and effectiveness. Badge earners will be able to show how improving and managing processes well enables better client and project outcomes, predictability, improved speed, reduced errors and rework, lower costs, better pricing, and higher profitability.
39a438ae-d176-4129-879e-e1457331c44b.name: Suffolk University's Process Improvement and Legal Project Management Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

efc36626-44b9-4985-bd63-5ab9daec0693.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Legal Innovation & Technology Certificate receive a newfound business perspective and the technological know-how to make work more efficient, client-focused, and profitable. Shifting from the traditional “protectionism” of legal operations to a new, contemporary model, this six course certificate was specifically built for modern professionals to gain current, specialized competencies that put them on the cutting edge of the legal industry.
efc36626-44b9-4985-bd63-5ab9daec0693.name: Suffolk University's Legal Innovation and Technology Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this certificate must complete all six (6) ten-week courses: (1) Legal Operations, (2) 21st Century Legal Services, (3) Process Improvement & Legal Project Management, (4) The Business of Delivering Legal Services, (5) Legal Technology Toolkit, (6) Design Thinking for Legal Professionals

b7ef0ea9-0673-43bc-98f2-03fbb665b173.description: Earners of Suffolk University's DEI certificate will be able to differentiate between diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace by exploring concepts such as unconscious bias, cultural intelligence, humility, privilege, power, and more. Multiple DEI best practices, such as allyship, emotional intelligence, and advocacy, will be explored to help participants identify DEI matters and concerns within an organization and offer possible action steps.
b7ef0ea9-0673-43bc-98f2-03fbb665b173.name: Suffolk University's Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Certificate : Becoming A Culture Change Agent: Harnessing the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete all five (5) microlearning modules consisting of 7-9 hours each of learning activities involving readings, videos, journal reflections, an emotional statement, an informational interview, a DEI critique & smart goal, a Heritage event, quizzes, and discussion boards.

Attend (or watch recording of) five (90-minute) bi-weekly group conversations guided by a master DEI facilitator on the subject matter covered by each module: (1) Overview of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) - Understanding the Fundamentals (2) Self-Reflection: The intersection of emotional intelligence and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (3) Organizational Culture and Supporting Others Using a DEI Lens (4) Communicating about Diversity, Equity, and inclusion (5) DEI Reflection.

DEI Action Plan: The final project for the DEI certificate requires you to spend time crafting your own DEI Action Plan. To become a culture change agent, initially, you must reflect on your own personal diversity, equity, and inclusion knowledge and contributions to building inclusive environments. Once that personal assessment is made, it is a perfect opportunity to determine how you would like to increase your knowledge around differences, culture, bias and be a productive ally or advocate.

929ba1dc-0ccb-427f-be0a-de3d3ee73bae.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Legal Operations badge will acquire knowledge of the evolving legal operations functions within corporate legal departments. Learners will sample hands-on deliverables expected from modern legal department leaders and learn the primary taxonomy of legal operations. Fundamental core concepts such as data analytics and project management will be thematically applied throughout the course, continually evolving the learner's skills.
929ba1dc-0ccb-427f-be0a-de3d3ee73bae.name: Suffolk University's Legal Operations Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

444aab09-0c75-4d4f-8074-7f9c34cfcc87.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Design Thinking for Legal Professionals badge will utilize human-centered approaches to solve clients' problems by identifying their needs and building solutions that provide maximum value. Learners will improve their organization's operations by practicing the key mindsets and principles of practical design work through developing prototypes, testing them, and iteratively improving these tools for better results.
444aab09-0c75-4d4f-8074-7f9c34cfcc87.name: Suffolk University's Design Thinking for Legal Professionals Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

8ce173ed-9bab-4bde-b3a1-1c61972097eb.description: Earners of Suffolk University's 21st Century Legal Services Badge will examine market insights to develop effectual strategic & tactical business recommendations for law firms & legal enterprises. By focusing on the trends transforming the legal services markets & the accompanying client demands associated with these changes, learners will be able to identify critical operational elements of a successful business to meet their clients' evolving needs better than their competition.
8ce173ed-9bab-4bde-b3a1-1c61972097eb.name: Suffolk University's 21st Century Legal Services Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

82fe17e7-895a-4aff-81e2-a859288c1f8e.description: Earners of Suffolk University’s Business of Delivering Legal Services Badge will gain insight of the fundamentals of running a business. This course includes an explanation of both accounting and financial concepts as it impacts data-driven decision making, key performance indicators (KPIs), and an approach to managing workflows as projects. Learners who are in finance, pricing, marketing, delivery or social media, will gain information to make changes or start a practice or position.
82fe17e7-895a-4aff-81e2-a859288c1f8e.name: Suffolk University's Business of Delivering Legal Services Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

df60c2c7-53de-4a00-91c1-e5fd2cde0928.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Legal Technology Toolkit badge will obtain a comprehensive understanding of the essential technologies monopolizing modern-day legal service providers to better evaluate their client's expectations & identify technology's current importance and future impact on legal services. Learners will be exposed to the legal skills of cybersecurity, collaboration tools, eDiscovery, technology competence, document automation, online dispute resolution, & smart contracts.
df60c2c7-53de-4a00-91c1-e5fd2cde0928.name: Suffolk University's Legal Technology Toolkit Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must engage in online lectures, actively participate in discussions with fellow learners, answer knowledge check questions, and complete assigned readings. This is a ten-week course in which learners engage in these learning activities for three to five hours per week.

4f4f04d6-55f4-4241-9487-ad98502b6129.description: Earners of Suffolk University's Business Ethics and Writing certificate will receive an actionable ethical foundation that can be applied immediately. By combining ethical decision-making and business communications, learners will explore the nuances of ethics in business, critically analyze business communications, hone business writing skills to be a more persuasive communicator, and build a solid ethical foundation for personal and professional decision-making.
4f4f04d6-55f4-4241-9487-ad98502b6129.name: Suffolk University's Business Ethics and Writing Certificate: Ethical Principles, Critical Thinking, and Writing for Today’s Business

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete all five (5) microlearning modules consisting of 5-10 hours each of learning activities involving readings, videos, discussion boards, knowledge checkpoints, writing assignments, quizzes, class discussions, and case studies.

Attend (or watch recording of) five (90-minute) bi-weekly group conversations guided by a master BWE facilitator on the subject matter covered by each module: (1) Thinking through Right and Wrong (2) Finding the Good (3) Doing Your Duty (4) The Virtuous Business (5) Ethical Analysis

Ethical Analysis and Business Recommendation Instructions Project: In a one- to three-page analysis, analyze an ethical dilemma from three perspectives of a case study. Your analysis will include background information, explanations of how each ethical framework informs decision-making, and your recommendation for action.

a21d4348-c331-4bbc-86ad-927c8a039a70.description: Earners of Suffolk University's self-paced Communicating with Flair course introduces fundamental concepts in communication to identify and implement essential workplace communication skills. Form persuasive arguments, make compelling presentations, write error-free emails and documents, and increase your impact as a skilled communicator. Credits: PMI PDUs: 3, Leadership PDUs: 1.75, Technical PM PDUs: 1.25, IACET CEUs: .3, HRCI Credits: 3, SHRM PDCs: 3
a21d4348-c331-4bbc-86ad-927c8a039a70.name: Suffolk University's Communicating with Flair Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must achieve an average test score of at least 70% to meet the minimum successful completion requirement and qualify to receive IACET CEUs.

0e8a97e7-1dbe-4fda-8962-9916d3ff5f20.description: Earners of Suffolk University's DT certificate will learn how organizations use principles of design thinking and biomimicry to create new ways of meeting the challenges of modern business. Through conceptual and practical concepts combined with experiential learning opportunities, earners build creative problem-solving skills that empower them to identify unique business prospects and provide highly valuable solutions to the issues faced by both customers and businesses.
0e8a97e7-1dbe-4fda-8962-9916d3ff5f20.name: Suffolk University's Design Thinking: Applying Discovery and Innovation in Practice

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete all five (5) microlearning modules consisting of 7-10 hours each of learning activities involving readings, videos, journal reflections, story-telling, creating a journey map and empathy map, a review on good and bad design, an empathy interview, knowledge checks, and discussion boards.

Attend (or watch recording of) five (90-minute) bi-weekly group conversations guided by a master DT facilitator on the subject matter covered by each module: (1) What Is Design Thinking? (2) Observe, Understand, and Create Empathy (3) Reframe Concept Statement and Ideate (4) Prototyping and Testing (5) Social Good & Final Presentations

The Design Challenge Project: The final project for the DT certificate is an immersive, course-long, team project that uses the design thinking ideas, methods, and processes to come up with a novel and viable solution to a challenge.

2161edd6-34cc-496f-a2c8-2132aa5d7538.description: Earners of Suffolk University's self-paced course introduces key concepts and terms to prepare learners to earn their LEED Green Associate v4 accreditation. The course is divided into modules that explain LEED process, LEED certification, and the knowledge domains associated with the seven LEED rating systems in a simple and straightforward way that can be quickly and easily understood. IACET CEUs: 1.4 (Contact Hours: 14 hours)
2161edd6-34cc-496f-a2c8-2132aa5d7538.name: Suffolk University's LEED® Green Associate v4™ Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Suffolk University, Center for Continuing and Professional Education
